law.catch_line: This section only applies to an employee who is in a position:...

text.section:
This section only applies to an employee who is in a position:
under a special appointment;
in the management service; or
in the executive service.

Each employee subject to this section:
serves at the pleasure of the employee's appointing authority; and
may be terminated from employment for any reason that is not illegal or unconstitutional, solely in the discretion of the appointing authority.

A management service employee or a special appointment employee designated by the Secretary under § 4-201(c)(2)(i) of this article may not be terminated for the purpose of creating a new position for another individual's appointment because of that individual's political affiliation, belief, or opinion.
An employee or an employee's representative may file a written appeal of an employment termination under this section as described under § 11-113 of this title.
